install.username_info: Username can contain any letters or numbers, without spaces
install.dbhost_info: The host name where the software will be installed.
install.dbuser_info: Username can contain any letters or numbers, without spaces
install.complete_info: Your database has been setup and user account created. Please proceed to the next page for login credentials.

users.title: Adding New Contacts
users.instructions:
Contacts are defined as all the people that contribute to the success and wellness of your company. You can add anyone from your clients and/or employees to your personal assistant and/or vendors.

Create contacts manually or begin by importing contacts from an existing database.

contracts.title: Adding New Contracts
contracts.instructions:
Contracts are agreements between parties which require signatures from both parties in order to be legally binding. The Professional integrates with Adobe EchoSign for all contract agreements.

Create contracts manually or begin by importing contracts from an existing database.

email.title: Connecting Email Accounts
email.instructions:
When you add your email accounts such as Yahoo Mail or Gmail to The Professional, you can send and read email messages from those accounts without switching between email apps. Each email account you add to The Professional is called a connected account.

You can currently connect almost any email account including the following:

companies.title: Adding New Companies
companies.instructions:
Companies are defined as institutions that you own/work for or institutions that are owned/worked for by your clients or other associates. Its best to always associate your contacts to a company even if they are sole proprietorships.

Create companies manually or begin by importing companies from an existing database.

deliverables.title: Adding New Deliverables
deliverables.instructions:
Deliverables are defined as the products and/or services that you sell to your clients and customers.

Create deliverables manually or begin by importing deliverables from an existing database.

events.title: Adding New Events
events.instructions:
Events are defined as scheduled appointments in which individuals assemble to discuss agendas. Events can be externally created by clients or internally created by team or staff.

Events are currently integrated with the following calendars:

Create events manually or begin by importing events from an existing database.

invoices.title: Adding New Invoices
invoices.instructions:
Invoices are defined as statements of work performed by your company for your clients. When creating an invoice, line items can include deliverables and/or project responsibilities.

Create invoices manually or begin by importing invoices from an existing Professional database.

payments.title: Capturing New Payments
payments.instructions:
Payments are defined fees captured after an invoice has been paid. Payments can be captured automatically by integrating with popular payment processors.

The following payment processors are accepted:

Payments can be captured manually, automatically or imported from an existing database.

posts.title: Adding New Posts
posts.instructions:
Posts are defined as written articles posted to blogs or social networks. You can opt to use The Professional as your blog or you can connect to an exiting blog or social network.

The following blogs and social networks are accepted:

Create posts manually or begin by importing posts from an existing database.

products.title: Adding New Products
products.instructions:
Products are defined as items created after a project is completed. Products are tangible items like software and possibly even buildings.

Product updates can be tracked with the following source code repositories:

Create products manually or begin by importing products from an existing database.

professions.title: Adding New Professions
professions.instructions:
Professions are defined as a paid occupation, especially one that involves prolonged training and a formal qualification.

Create professions manually or begin by importing professions from an existing database.

responsibilities.title: Adding New Responsibilities
responsibilities.instructions:
Responsibilities are the basic duties of qualified professionals.

Create responsibilities manually or begin by importing responsibilities from an existing database.

projects.title: Adding New Projects
projects.instructions:
Projects are defined as units of work by a team or individual to create a desired product for a client.

There are three types of projects, sequential, parallel and single action:

A sequential project is one whose actions must be performed in a certain order. The bake a cake project is a sequential project; you can't bake the cake before you buy the ingredients and you can't buy the ingredients before you find a recipe.

A parallel project is a project whose actions can be completed in any order. For example, a pay bills project whose actions are pay rent, pay cell phone bill, pay water bill, etc. This project would be considered parallel because it doesn't matter what order you pay your bills in; it just matters that they all are completed.

A single action list is a special kind of project that usually consists of projects with only one step to complete or an assortment of related actions (like, buy groceries). Often times, it is helpful to create a miscellaneous project to keep things organized.

Create products manually or begin by importing products from an existing database.

proposals.title: Adding New Proposals
proposals.instructions:
Proposals are defined as statements of work to be performed by your company for your clients. When creating a proposal, line items can include deliverables and/or project responsibilities.

Create proposals manually or begin by importing proposals from an existing Professional database.

releases.title: Adding New Releases
releases.instructions:
Releases are defined as revisions or project products. A product can have multiple releases. Releases for a product can be active or inactive.

Create releases manually or begin by importing releases from an existing database.

resources.title: Adding New Project Resource
resources.instructions:
Project Resources are defined as a person or company with materials, money, staff, information and any other assets necessary for effective operation of a project.

Create resources manually or begin by importing resources from an existing database.

missions.title: Adding New Missions
missions.instructions:
Missions are defined as a list of project goals. For example, one mission of a new website project is to 'Design the Website'. Work items are added to fulfill the obligation of the mission.

Create missions manually or begin by importing missions from an existing database.

sprints.title: Adding New Sprints
sprints.instructions:
Sprints are defined as repeatable work cycles in which approved work items are completed and reviewed. Each project should have sprints or work cycles for delivery of project products. For example, an interior design project may include a sprint where the designer creates a design preview that must be approved by the client before proceeding to the next sprint or work cycle

Create sprints manually or begin by importing sprints from an existing database.

submissions.title: Adding New Submissions
submissions.instructions:
Submissions are defined as requests for additional information or work submitted by clients. An example of a submission, include consultation or contact forms. Submissions are captured automatically on your Professional site but they can also be added manually if capturing over the phone or in person.

Create submissions manually or begin by importing submissions from an existing database.

timecards.title: Adding New Timecards
timecards.instructions:
Timecards are defined as logs used to report starting and quiting times for staff or contractors.

Create timecards manually or begin by importing timecards from an existing database.

work.title: Adding New Work
work.instructions:
Work is defined as task items to be completed to fulfill a mission during a sprint (work cycle).

Create work manually or begin by importing work from an existing database.

all.goal_info: A short expression of the purpose of a Sprint, often a business problem that is addressed. Functionality might be adjusted during the Sprint in order to achieve the Sprint Goal.
all.planning_meeting_info: A time-boxed event of 8 hours, or less, to start a Sprint. It serves for the Scrum Team to inspect the work from the Product Backlog thatâ€™s most valuable to be done next and design that work into Sprint backlog.
all.retro_meeting_info: A time-boxed event of 3 hours, or less, to end a Sprint. It serves for the Scrum Team to inspect the past Sprint and plan for improvements to be enacted during the next Sprint.
all.review_meeting_info: A time-boxed event of 4 hours, or less, to conclude the development work of a Sprint. It serves for the Scrum Team and the stakeholders to inspect the Increment of product resulting from the Sprint, assess the impact of the work performed on overall progress and update the Product backlog in order to maximize the value of the next period.
